description: The Safe Browsing APIs (v4) let your client applications check URLs against Google's constantly updated lists of unsafe web resources. Examples of unsafe web resources are social engineering sites (phishing and deceptive sites) and sites that host malware or unwanted software. Any URL found on a Safe Browsing list is considered unsafe.

blocks.name: checkUrlsSafety
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to check if URLs are included on any of the Safe Browsing lists. If a URL is found on one or more lists, the matching information is returned.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Google.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: A client ID that (hopefully) uniquely identifies the client implementation of the Safe Browsing API.

args.name: clientVersion
args.info: Required: The version of the client implementation.

args.name: threatTypes
args.info: Required: Json array of the threats. See README for more details.

args.name: platformTypes
args.info: Required: Json array of the platforms types. See README for more details.

args.name: threatEntryTypes
args.info: Required: Json array of the threat entries types. See README for more details.

args.name: threatEntries
args.info: Required: Json array of objects. The threats entries. See README for more details.

blocks.name: getThreatLists
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to retrieve the names of the Safe Browsing lists

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Google.

blocks.name: getThreatListUpdates
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to update the Safe Browsing lists in the local database

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Google.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: A client ID that (hopefully) uniquely identifies the client implementation of the Safe Browsing API.

args.name: clientVersion
args.info: Required: The version of the client implementation.

args.name: threatType
args.info: Required: The type of the threat.

args.name: platformType
args.info: Required: The type of the platform.

args.name: threatEntryType
args.info: Required: The type of the threat entry.

args.name: state
args.info: Required: The current state of the client for the requested list (the encrypted client state that was received from the last successful list update).

args.name: maxUpdateEntries
args.info: Required: The maximum size in number of entries. The update will not contain more entries than this value. This should be a power of 2 between 2**10 and 2**20. If zero, no update size limit is set.

args.name: maxDatabaseEntries
args.info: Required: Sets the maximum number of entries that the client is willing to have in the local database. This should be a power of 2 between 2**10 and 2**20. If zero, no database size limit is set.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Requests the list for a specific geographic location. If not set the server may pick that value based on the user's IP address. Expects ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

args.name: supportedCompressions
args.info: Required: Json array. The compression types supported by the client. See README for more details

blocks.name: checkSafetyByHashs
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to check if a URL is on a Safe Browsing list, the client must first compute the hash and hash prefix of the URL

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Google.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: A client ID that (hopefully) uniquely identifies the client implementation of the Safe Browsing API.

args.name: clientVersion
args.info: Required: The version of the client implementation.

args.name: clientStates
args.info: Required: Json array. The current client states for each of the client's local threat lists. See README for more details.

args.name: threatTypes
args.info: Required: Json array. The threat types to be checked. See README for more details.

args.name: platformTypes
args.info: Required: Json array. The platform types to be checked. See README for more details.

args.name: threatEntryTypes
args.info: Required: Json array. The entry types to be checked. See README for more details.

args.name: threatEntries
args.info: Required: Json array of objects. The threat entries to be checked. See README for more details.
